channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bagged Rubbish, 8th November
item.description:
You’ve no sooner collected the bags of rubbish dumped outside the Air B&B at 27 Cato St and they’ve dumped a load more!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Cato Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Forgotten roadworks barriers, 8th November

item.title: Potholes by the bus stop getting worse and worse, 8th November
item.description:
These potholes just get worse and worse. Now quite deep and always filled with water, even on dry days. Terrible for cyclists and pedestrians. Will be lethal when the weather freezes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary lights causing congestion, 8th November
item.description:
Temporary lights at this location are causing major congestion in the deptford area. Today I sat in traffic from Blackheath prince of wales Road all the way to Deptford bride DLR because of all the vehicles trying to left on Deptford church street. This needs to be looked into as it is causing chaos for locals and is defeating the object of introducing lower emissions as the traffic queues are very very long.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deptford Church Street, Deptford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Demantling scaffolding without proper safety barriers, 8th November
item.description:
This scaffolding was being dismantled without due care to public safety!! This company needs to be reprimanded. I have a video but unfortunately the website does not allow me to upload a video. So I have submitted photos which clearly show members of the public passing through the scaffolding whilst it is being dismantled. Even a lady being push through on a wheel chair. I have particular concern for public safety of this sort as my friend Amanda Trlfer lost her life due to debris falling on her from a working building site. Criminal charges were brought against the company. This must be investigated and formally reported. It is careless and reckless.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
